meanings.definition: Impossible to breach or break through.
meanings.sent1: The fortress had an unbreachable wall that kept all enemies out.
meanings.sent2: The lock on the door was unbreachable, ensuring our safety.
meanings.sent3: The unbreachable barrier around the garden kept the mischievous rabbits from eating the vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an unbreachable shield, protecting her from any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The knight's armor was unbreachable, shining in the sunlight as a symbol of strength.

meanings.definition: Not able to be violated or trespassed upon.
meanings.sent1: The privacy of his diary was unbreachable, hidden safely under lock and key.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the sacred temple were unbreachable, respected by all who entered.
meanings.sent3: The unbreachable trust between the two friends was unbreakable, like a bond forged in steel.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty was unbreachable, standing firm even in the face of temptation.
meanings.sent5: The contract was unbreachable, ensuring both parties upheld their promises.
